text.p: Here are the highlights of stories in the Danish press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

--- Copenhagen's Tivoli amusement gardens international division is next month to announce plans to cooperate with Germany's Tivoli Berlin GmbH on setting up a similar park in Brandenburg in the year 2000. A Tivoli-style park is to open in Japan this summer.
--- Denmark's Royal Life Guards are considering boycotting exercises after dark on provincial roads after one of their columns was hit by a van killing two soldiers and injuring 18 in an accident.
--- Denmark's clothing industry continues to cut staff due to tougher price competition, moving production to low wage countries.

--- The first 18 months' construction work on the future Oeresund bridge and tunnel fixed link between Denmark and Sweden has been completed more or less on schedule, only two weeks late. The road-rail link over the Baltic strait is due to open in the year 2000.
--- The Copenhagen Stock Exchange is calling for Danish rules for company takeovers to be tightened with new regulations from the European Union already on the way.
